#The Review Phase# ##Two different level of reviews## As part of Pulse we recommend always having two level of reviews happening at some point before production on the chain of instances.
##Functional Review During this review the process owner (Same concept as ITIL) should: * Ensure the development meets the process needs * Ensure it meets the standards defined * Make sure the release notes is well written * Clients are communicated to (if needed)
##Technical Review Also known as "Code Review" is the review done by technical folks getting deep into the code. The code scans helps with this work a lot, but not everything can be automatically checked. Code reviews check for: * Code standards (indentation, comments, debug logs) * Coding Best Practices * Redundant code * Ensure that the development considered: * Performance / Efficiency * Scalability * Upgradeability * Usability / Reusability
##Marking it as rejected/approved The review is the same as a normal approval. You can approve/reject it from the menu item "My Approvals", from the e-mail notification, from the related list on Pulse or any other enabled method.
##What's next? Once all necessary reviews are completed, the development request will calculate the next phase. * "Ready for Testing": Whenever the environment it just went to requires Testing * "Pending Schedule": When it doesn't require testing but the next environment requires Schedule * "Promoting": When neither testing nor schedule is needed, it will automatically move it to the next environment Most cases the reviews are done prior to get to CERT environment and it will move to "Ready for Testing" for user acceptance testing.
